solution_line_template: The price per 500 mL milk from the {num_packs_in_set} packs is ${cost_two_packs}/{num_packs_in_set} = $<<{cost_two_packs}/{num_packs_in_set}={price_per_pack_bulk}>>{price_per_pack_bulk}.
This means that for each pack of 500 mL milk, you can save ${cost_individual_pack} - ${price_per_pack_bulk} = ${savings_per_pack}.
Ten sets of {packs_per_set} packs mean {num_sets} x {packs_per_set} = <<{num_sets}*{packs_per_set}={total_packs_to_buy}>>{total_packs_to_buy} packs of 500 mL of milk.
So, your total savings will be ${savings_per_pack} x {total_packs_to_buy} = $<<{savings_per_pack}*{total_packs_to_buy}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}.
